author: konmaorg
title: Mesh Network-Konma Xperience Center
description: Learning centers are boring! Imagine an Xperience center instead that shows real-world examples of using Blockchain technology!

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal wants to build up an off-line Xperience Center in the tech-city Chennai, India. I think this is an innovative idea since everyone who has an interest in tech will only reach out on cyber-space. The team plans to design a nice tour for visitors to walk in and engage in blockchain/ Cardano/ ADA. This proposal addresses the challenge at the point of delivering information to the people who don’t have the access to the blockchain by making physical interactions in the centre. If this centre is well-designed and the team could run good marketing campaigns, I think it could attract people even without IT ground and may get them involved in the community spontaneously. Chennai is a nice location with an appropriate demographic, I think the community here will welcome an experience centre like this. 
However, after reading the action plan, I realise that although this is a good idea, its actual impact on Cardano seems not to be high. Konma is already an organisation with multiple channels, and the proposer is trying to integrate them with this X-experience Centre. This could be a huge advantage, otherwise a disadvantage. The reason I say so is that introducing Cardano to people is the essential point of opening this centre, I don’t see the team having a detailed plan of what content to introduce to visitors and how to handle their reactions/ interactions/ engagement. The proposal presents very much about giving them chocolate, showcasing the Konma lifestyle or Konma art pieces, etc. but these activities are just the very first step for catching their attention. The real spine of the project should be invested more about Cardano, how to create a Cardano hub with all the speciality of the Konma community.
f6_assessments.q1:
Compared to the proposal submitted in Fund 7, this round I could see the proposer added information about team members. It’s a good point. After checking around the LinkedIn of all team members, I have a concern about the feasibility of human resources for this project. This X-perience centre is very much about blockchain, decentralisation, technical stuff, etc. but I see only the founder of Konma having some experience with blockchain management (still I couldn’t find how specific his experience is), all other members are blockchain enthusiasts with various specialisation. 
I see a budget presented, but I think it should be broken down smaller. What equipment/ machines will be bought for renovation & infrastructure? Is there any reference for the renting cost? How many staffs will be hired for operating the centre? How much money they will be paid for an hour working at the centre? On which platform that the team will run the marketing campaigns? Questions like these are my suggestions for the proposer. 
Another thing I want to advise the team is that the action plan – it takes 9 months for the team to launch all kinds of Konma channels in the experience centre until the first set of a staking pool will be held, that’s inappropriate for Fund 8. This round we aim to build “minimum-viable hubs” with the small unit but effective one. It will take too much time & cost to run all these activities for attracting people. Furthermore, the proposer doesn’t have a plan to deal with risks and challenges. What if after a lot of time and effort of building this centre, people would not find it interesting and we have a low amount of visitors?  The proposer should discuss this more.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has a roadmap with 12 milestones for each month. The time horizon should be estimated and added. Key metrics are listed down quite reasonable but I think that KPIs should be filled into numbers. Just an example, how many participants from the Catalyst community could the experience attract - can be estimated by the number of Indian/ Chennai people who are active on the platforms of Catalyst/ Cardano. Respectively, other KPIs should be defined clearly. 
This proposal provides me with not very sufficient information to assess its progress. However, I still think that this is a good idea. I advise the team to work more on this project.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is for the creation of an walk in Xperince center for people to learn from examples how Konma is using blockchain and building solutions on Cardano.
The point here is that dry learning is boring and there should be an interesting alternative for better engagement and retention.
The proposal seeks $45000 (9% of the challenge funding) and according to the objectives of the challenge proposals with 5% or less should be encouraged. 
The Xperience center will be established in Chennai, India in an area densely populated with tech savvy people. The proposer predicts 500 active users to join the community per month.
I agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge, due to the request by the challenge team to promote lower budget proposals.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal has a timeline with monthly milestones for 12 months. The timeline does not provide detail, just the major categories/directions that should be worked on in a given month.
It is not explicitly shown how the project will ensure resilience and self-reliance after the funding ends.
The proposal provides a budget without much detail on it. Rent, renovation, operation cost, marketing.
The proposer acknowledges as a risk the self sustainability of the project, unfortunately does not provide mitigation strategy for that risk. 
The team is presented and with active links to linkedin profiles. The team looks experienced in the fields needed for this proposal to work. 
I agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal classifies measurable parameters for audit of the project. However the proposer does not point to exact benchmarks to be reached by set time. Also the proposer does not specify where will the information needed for auditing be presented. 
Success benchmarks are 5000community members in 10 months and other immeasurable parameters.
I want to point out that although the proposer does not mentions it in the auditing section. The auditor could use the monthly milestone plan to measure the progress of the project and release funds accordingly.
I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: Experiential learning has been greatly seen in the western edu and with online models grown during covid, it is important to have this especially in the new tech fronts like blockchain. Team's presence in this domain is a hugeplus and team's willingness to share their ongoing projects as experiential knowledge sharing is a gamechanging idea.
f6_assessments.q1: 1-Team- 15 Core team, 13 mentors 2-Cost - fair cost plans for implementation. This plan could be like ordering Apple products online vs visiting an onsite showroom. Given the level of tech colleges/software development parks, the initial experiment will grow like we see franchise models of McDonald's or KFC. This will be true learning experience on real projects from their portfolio and in future other re-engineering of major cardano core work would be helping the newbie to feel empowered quickly.
f6_assessments.q2: KPIs shared from number of footfalls, number of organized discourses, ADA payments are very relevant to success of team as well as expansion of cardano community in India. Having a strong community of konma believers would be also cardano believers or the stronger proponents of decentralization. Team's progress can be tracked easily as the site is renovated for the experiential learning, and team is on a journey of their mission 'Built for EveryONE"

f6_assessments.q0: Indeed, this is a big project, including building a center, finding suitable products for consumers, and combining it with the application of blockchain to products, building processes to create products (chocolate…) at the center. I think you should break it down into different projects, the feasibility will be higher. How to integrate blockchain and Cardano into the product is also not clear. You raised the challenge that the project is difficult to maintain on its own, so do you have any solution for that?
f6_assessments.q1: This is a project to give people more access to blockchain and Cardano, but all the budget is to build infrastructure, I think this is not suitable. The total budget of 43,800 is another figure from the requested 45,000. The team also does not have members specializing in R&D to develop products
f6_assessments.q2: While building the hub, what metrics will you provide for the community to monitor and quantify? Does the project mention payment in ADA, when there is no stable-coin, ADA price fluctuates constantly, how will the product be priced? I've also been following the project at fund 7, really there's not much progress yet

f6_assessments.q0: The Mesh Network-Konma Xperience Center proposal addresses Scale-up Cardano's community hub by setting up an Xperience Center to showcase examples of using blockchain technology. The proposer identify the Xperience center or innovation hub as the solution for this challenge. Mesh Network and staking pool are their future projects. They have mentioned self-sustaining as the foremost challenge which is critical for the long run viability of this project. The goal of this proposal is aligned with the challenge settings but the scalability could be a possible challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The roadmap shows general plan of what they try to achieve in each month. They could provide more detail in each item in the roadmap. The staking pool is part of their one year roadmap. When they detail the budget breakdown, some costs like real estate rent fluctuate widely between 800-9600 per year which is quite concerning if this project is feasible at all. The operation cost (salary of how many staff). The majority of fund will go towards rental and renovation cost instead of blockchain technology to amplify how blockchain can transform life. The Konma team links/ references are given. The proposal has to provide more detail on roadmap and also be transparent and considerate on the budget as it looks not so sustainable to bring this project to completion after one year.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has not provided sufficient information on their monthly timeline.  It would be a challenge to see if the project is on track. How would they show 5000 community members in 10 months? Would the figure be shown in the App, in the Xperience Center or else. The rent and renovation budget for this proposal is quite high and could emerge as potential issues as we go along the project. While the proposer understand the concept of scale-up community hub challenge, he approaches the solution in simplistic format of setting up the Xperience Center. It will be quite difficult for the community to keep track of operating cost incurred from running the Xperience center .

f6_assessments.q0: The project is about building an education Hub focusing on experience by will showing real-world examples of how DLT is used to solve daily problems. For example as the proposer explained, people who may have walked in a center just to buy a bar of chocolate will get to see the technology that is giving them the transparency and food traceability. This is more convincing and easy for people to learn a new concept than telling them we used blockchain technology to give you traceability. They work both online and offline. The first Xperience center will be located in the southern part of Chennai, India, which has crowded and dense popularity, an IT district with 70% of the population being tech-savvy (they could open a minimum of 50 Xperience centers there). This idea of the Hub is great since the importance of Education is unsuspicious, but the traditional studying method shows its weakness so it is necessary to have an method more effective. Education Hub is also a way for people to be more interested in related activities, especially Cardano, as a natural way of marketing. The requested budget also matches the criteria of the challenge: do not exceed 5% of the total Challenge budget.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers defined clearly about what a Konma Xperience Center will have, which makes the proposal more persuasive. The proposal includes the action plan which is on point, it shows their vision about the development of the project. The explanation of each steps is really detailed and reasonable. Moreover, all the team member have relevant experience, and their profiles are linked with LinkedIn profile, which make it easy for CAs to find out more about them. The choice of the first Xperience center to implement the project is also very reasonable. The fact that this city has many tech-savvy make it more accessible in the first time they introduce their work to the local residents. The proposal also includes their analysis of challenge they will face, which I think is focused and consistent with the overall goal of the challenge. Therefore, it is likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal includes a detailed plan and timeline for delivering the solution and the total goal for the projects. These plan and goals are clear and sufficient to audit the progress, but it would be better if they separate the goals into each stage of the plan so as to track the progress more easily.

solution: An Xperience center for members to learn from real-time examples and how Konma is using blockchain and building solutions on Cardano.
experience: We have experts in retail, e-commerce, community management, marketing & technology faculty to provide relevant experience to the community.
